00036 bool 
00037 RDFParser::parse(char *pathFile)
00038 {
00039     DataTime t1, t2;
00040     getTime(&t1);
00041     cout.precision(4);
00042     
00043     // Parsing the config file
00044     cout << "[" << showpoint << t1.user - t1.user << "]  Parsing config file: " << pathFile << endl;
00045     bool parsed = parseConfig(pathFile);
00046     
00047     map<string,string>::iterator it;
00048     string line;
00049     int ntriples = 0;
00050     
00051     // Input File/Pipe management
00052     FILE *filePipe;
00053     std::string pipeCommand;
00054     ifstream *fileStream = NULL; 
00055     boost::fdistream *pipeStream = NULL;
00056     
00057     // RDF Parser
00058     RDFSyntaxMediator rdfmediator;
00059     DictionaryTriples dictionaryTriples;
00060 
00061     if (parsed)
00062     {
00063         // Performing HDT on the set of properties
00064         // ***************************************
00065         
00066         // 1) Opening the dataset
00067         it = properties.find(DATASET);
00068         string &datasetName = it->second;
00069 
00070         if(stringHasEnding(datasetName, ".gz")) {
00071             pipeCommand = "gunzip -c ";
00072         } else if(stringHasEnding(datasetName, ".bz2")) {
00073             pipeCommand = "bunzip2 -c ";
00074         } 
00075 
00076         if(pipeCommand.length()>0) {
00077             pipeCommand.append(datasetName);
00078 
00079             if ((filePipe=popen(pipeCommand.c_str(),"r")) == NULL) {
00080                 throw "popen() failed";
00081             }
00082 
00083             input = pipeStream = new boost::fdistream(fileno(filePipe));
00084         } else {        
00085             input = fileStream = new ifstream(datasetName.c_str());
00086         }
00087         if (!input->good())
00088         {
00089             cout << "   <ERROR> Please check the dataset in " << datasetName << endl;
00090             return false;
00091         }
00092         
00093         // 2) Testing dictionary options: it is built on a first pass
00094         //    which gathers statistics and performs the chosen ordering.
00095         //    First, the ordering parameter is retrieved and next the
00096         //    chosen dictionary class is instantiated.
00097         getTime(&t2);
00098         cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Building Dictionary from " << datasetName << endl;
00099         
00100         it = properties.find(D_ORDERING);
00101         
00102         if ((it->second).compare(VD_ORDERING_LEX) == 0)
00103         {
00104             // ** Lexicographic ordering **
00105             it = properties.find(D_ENCODING);
00106             if ((it->second).compare(VPLAIN) == 0)
00107             {
00108                 // PLAIN dictionary on hash tables: checking (optional) 
00109                 // size configuration.
00110                 it = properties.find(HASH_SIZE);
00111                 
00112                 if (it != properties.end())
00113                 {
00114                     // New plain dictionary with the chosen size.                   
00115                     dictionary = new PlainDictionary(atoi((it->second).c_str()));
00116                 }
00117                 else
00118                 {                   
00119                     // New plain dictionary with the by default size.
00120                     dictionary = new PlainDictionary();
00121                 }
00122             }
00123             else if ((it->second).compare(VD_ENCODING_IND) == 0)
00124             {
00125                 // INDEXED dictionary (for future)
00126                 cout << "   <WARNING> Indexed Dictionary encoding is not currently supported" << endl;
00127                 return false;
00128             }
00129             else
00130             {
00131                 cout << "   <ERROR> Dictionary encoding " << it->second << " is not supported" << endl;
00132                 return false;
00133             }
00134         }
00135         else
00136         {
00137             cout << "   <ERROR> Dictionary ordering " << it->second << " is not supported" << endl;
00138             return false;
00139         }
00140     
00141         //@javi
00142         // Checks RDF syntax; only n3 is currently supported.
00143         
00144         it = properties.find(RDF_PARSER);
00145         if ((it != properties.end()) && (it->second).compare(RDF_PARSER_OWN) == 0)
00146         {
00147             node = new string[3];
00148             
00149             while (getline(*input,line))
00150             {
00151                 //cout << "> " << line << endl;
00152                 ntriples++;
00153                 parseTripleN3(line);
00154                 dictionary->checkTriple(node);
00155             }
00156         } else {
00157             it = properties.find(DATASET);
00158             
00159             dictionaryTriples.dictionary = dictionary;
00160             dictionaryTriples.triples = NULL;
00161             dictionaryTriples.ntriples= new int();
00162             *dictionaryTriples.ntriples=0;
00163             rdfmediator.parsing(const_cast<char*> (it->second.c_str()),dictionaryTriples);
00164             ntriples = *dictionaryTriples.ntriples;
00165         }
00166 
00167         dictionary->split();
00168         
00169         // 3) Sorting Dictionary (LEXICOGRAPHIC)
00170         //    Retrieve the id mapping choice
00171         getTime(&t2);
00172         cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Sorting Dictionary" << endl;
00173         
00174         it = properties.find(MAPPING);
00175         if ((it->second).compare(VMAPPING_1) == 0)
00176         {
00177             mapping = MAPPING1;
00178         } 
00179         else if ((it->second).compare(VMAPPING_2) == 0)
00180         {
00181             mapping = MAPPING2;
00182         }
00183         else
00184         {
00185             cout << "   <ERROR> Mapping " << it->second << " is not supported" << endl;
00186             return false;
00187         }
00188 
00189         dictionary->lexicographicSort(mapping);
00190         
00191         // 4) Testing triples options: it is built on a second pass.
00192         //    The graph parsing is retrieved and the object is 
00193         //    instantiated by according with the encoding choice. The
00194         //    resultant structure is finally sorted on parsing choice.
00195         getTime(&t2);
00196         cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Building Triples" << endl;
00197 
00198         // Needed?
00199         if(pipeCommand.length()>0) { // Cannot seek on pipes
00200             // Close old pipe
00201             delete pipeStream;
00202             pclose(filePipe);
00203     
00204             // Create new one from the begining
00205             if ((filePipe=popen(pipeCommand.c_str(),"r")) == NULL) {
00206                 throw "popen() failed";
00207             }
00208 
00209             input = pipeStream = new boost::fdistream(fileno(filePipe));
00210 
00211         } else {
00212             input->clear();
00213             input->seekg (0, ios::beg);
00214         }
00215 
00216         it = properties.find(PARSING);
00217         if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_SPO) == 0)
00218         {
00219             parsing = SPO;
00220         } 
00221         else if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_SOP) == 0)
00222         {
00223             parsing = SOP;
00224         }
00225         else if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_PSO) == 0)
00226         {
00227             parsing = PSO;
00228         }
00229         else if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_POS) == 0)
00230         {
00231             parsing = POS;
00232         }
00233         else if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_OSP) == 0)
00234         {
00235             parsing = OSP;
00236 
00237             if (mapping == MAPPING1)
00238             {
00239                 // *********** NOT SUPPORTED
00240                 // Estas dos no las soportamos porque al utilizar este
00241                 // mapeo se rompe la continuidad en la asignaciÃ³n de
00242                 // identificadores para los objetos.
00243                 // ***********
00244                 cout << "   <ERROR> Configuration with mapping = " << parsing << " and parsing = " << parsing << " is not supported" << endl;
00245                 return false;
00246             }
00247 
00248         }
00249         else if ((it->second).compare(VPARSING_OPS) == 0)
00250         {
00251             parsing = OPS;
00252             if (mapping == MAPPING1)
00253             {   
00254                 // *********** NOT SUPPORTED
00255                 // Estas dos no las soportamos porque al utilizar este
00256                 // mapeo se rompe la continuidad en la asignaciÃ³n de
00257                 // identificadores para los objetos.
00258                 // ***********
00259                 cout << "   <ERROR> Configuration with mapping = " << parsing << " and parsing = " << parsing << " is not supported" << endl;
00260                 return false;
00261             }
00262 
00263         }
00264         else 
00265         {
00266             cout << "   <ERROR> Mapping " << it->second << " is not supported" << endl;
00267             return false;
00268         }
00269                 
00270         it = properties.find(T_ENCODING);
00271         if ((it->second).compare(VPLAIN) == 0)
00272         {
00273             // PLAIN triples
00274             triples = new PlainTriples(dictionary, ntriples, parsing);
00275             t_encoding = PLAIN;
00276         }
00277         else if ((it->second).compare(VT_ENCODING_COMP) == 0)
00278         {
00279             // COMPACT triples  
00280             triples = new CompactTriples(dictionary, ntriples, parsing);
00281             t_encoding = COMPACT;
00282         }
00283         else if ((it->second).compare(VT_ENCODING_BIT) == 0)
00284         {
00285             // BITMAP triples   
00286             triples = new BitmapTriples(dictionary, ntriples, parsing);
00287             t_encoding = BITMAP;
00288         }
00289         else if ((it->second).compare(VT_ENCODING_K2) == 0)
00290         {
00291             // K2TREE triples (for future)
00292             t_encoding = K2TREE;
00293             cout << "   <WARNING> K2-tree Triples encoding is not currently supported" << endl;
00294         }
00295         else
00296         {
00297             cout << "   <ERROR> Triples encoding " << it->second << " is not supported" << endl;
00298         }
00299 
00300         int subject, predicate, object;
00301         
00302         //@javi
00303         // Checks RDF syntax; only n3 is currently supported.
00304         
00305         
00306         it = properties.find(RDF_PARSER);
00307         if ((it != properties.end()) && (it->second).compare(RDF_PARSER_OWN) == 0)
00308         {
00309             while (getline(*input,line)) 
00310             {
00311                 parseTripleN3(line);
00312                 
00313                 subject = dictionary->retrieveID(node[0], VOC_SUBJECT);
00314                 predicate = dictionary->retrieveID(node[1], VOC_PREDICATE);
00315                 object = dictionary->retrieveID(node[2], VOC_OBJECT);
00316                 
00317                 triples->insert(subject, predicate, object);
00318             }   
00319         } else {
00320             it = properties.find(DATASET);
00321             rdfmediator;
00322             dictionaryTriples.triples = triples;
00323             rdfmediator.parsing(const_cast<char*> (it->second.c_str()),dictionaryTriples);
00324             
00325         }       
00326         triples->graphSort();
00327         
00328         // 5) Clustering is only available for parsing 'pso'.
00329         if (parsing == PSO)
00330         {
00331             it = properties.find(CLUSTER);
00332             if (it != properties.end())
00333             {
00334                 if ((it->second).compare(VYES) == 0)
00335                 {
00336                     getTime(&t2);
00337                     cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Clustering" << endl;
00338                     triples->clustering();
00339                 }
00340             }           
00341         }
00342         
00343         // 6) Writing Dictionary
00344         getTime(&t2);
00345         cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Writing HDT" << endl;
00346 
00347         string outputPath;
00348         int d_separator;
00349         
00350         it = properties.find(OUTPUT);
00351         if (it != properties.end())
00352         {
00353             outputPath = it->second;
00354         }
00355         else
00356         {
00357             cout << "   <WARNING> Not found output information -> HDT results stored in current location" << endl;
00358             outputPath = "./default";
00359         }
00360         mkpathfile(outputPath.c_str(),0744);
00361         
00362         it = properties.find(D_SEPARATOR);
00363         if (it != properties.end())
00364         {
00365             d_separator = atoi((it->second).c_str());
00366         }
00367         else
00368         {
00369             cout << "   <WARNING> By default '\2' character is used in the Dictionary encoding" << endl;
00370             d_separator = 2;
00371         }       
00372         
00373         dictionary->write(outputPath, d_separator);
00374         /*                  
00375             if (property.compare(D_COMPRESSION) == 0)
00376             {
00377                 d_compression = "";
00378                 if (value.compare(VD_COMPRESSION_PPM) == 0) d_compression = VD_COMPRESSION_PPM;
00379                 if (value.compare(VD_COMPRESSION_LZ) == 0) d_compression = VD_COMPRESSION_LZ;
00380                 if (value.compare(VNONE) == 0) d_compression = VNONE;
00381 
00382                 if (d_compression.compare("") == 0)
00383                 {
00384                     cout << "   <ERROR> Dictionary compression " << value << " is not supported" << endl;
00385                     parsed = false;
00386                 }
00387             }
00388         */
00389         
00390         // 7) Writing Triples
00391         //    Returns the number of triples effectively writen (note
00392         //    that the original dataset can contain repeated triples)
00393         ntriples = triples->write(outputPath);      
00394         
00395         /* CompresiÃ³n de los triples
00396          *
00397             if (property.compare(T_COMPRESSION) == 0)
00398             {
00399                 t_compression = "";
00400                 if (value.compare(VD_COMPRESSION_HUF) == 0) t_compression = VD_COMPRESSION_HUF;
00401                 if (value.compare(VNONE) == 0) t_compression = VNONE;
00402 
00403                 if (t_compression.compare("") == 0)
00404                 {
00405                     cout << "   <ERROR> Triples compression " << value << " is not supported" << endl;
00406                     parsed = false;
00407                 }
00408             }
00409         */  
00410 
00411         
00412         // 8) Writing Header
00413         header = new Header(parsing, mapping, d_separator, t_encoding, 
00414                             dictionary->getNsubjects(), dictionary->getNpredicates(), dictionary->getNobjects(), dictionary->getSsubobj(),
00415                             ntriples, dictionary->getNLiterals(), dictionary->getMaxID());
00416         header->write(outputPath);
00417         
00418         //header->write(outputPath, parsing, mapping, d_separator, t_encoding, 
00419         //            dictionary->getNsubjects(), dictionary->getNpredicates(), dictionary->getNobjects(), dictionary->getSsubobj(), ntriples);
00420                       
00421         // 9) Checking optional gnuplot generation (only for parsings 
00422         //    'pso' and 'pos')
00423         if ((parsing == PSO) || (parsing == POS))
00424         {
00425             it = properties.find(GNUPLOT_PATH);
00426             if (it != properties.end())
00427             {
00428                 string &gnuplotPath = it->second;
00429                 mkpathfile(gnuplotPath.c_str(), 0744);
00430                 
00431                 getTime(&t2);
00432                 cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Generating Gnuplot on " << gnuplotPath << endl;
00433 
00434                 int max = dictionary->getMaxID();
00435                 int npredicates = dictionary->getNpredicates();
00436                 vector <string> predicates(npredicates+1);
00437                 
00438                 for (int i = 1; i<=npredicates; i++)
00439                 {
00440                     string p = dictionary->retrieveString(i, VOC_PREDICATE);
00441                     predicates[i] = p;
00442                 }
00443                 triples->gnuplot(npredicates, predicates, max, gnuplotPath.c_str());
00444             }
00445         }
00446 
00447         // 10) In and Out Degree
00448         it = properties.find(DEGREE_PATH);
00449         if(it != properties.end() && ((parsing==SPO)||(parsing==PSO))) {
00450             getTime(&t2);
00451             cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  Calculate Degree Metrics on " << it->second <<endl;
00452         
00453             mkpathfile((it->second).c_str(), 0744);
00454             triples->calculateDegrees(it->second);
00455         }
00456         
00457         // All done
00458         getTime(&t2);
00459         cout << "[" << showpoint << t2.user - t1.user << "]  All done" << endl;
00460     }
00461     else
00462     {
00463         cout << endl << "   <ERROR> Revised parsing errors" << endl;
00464         return false;
00465     }
00466     
00467     if(pipeCommand.length()>0) {
00468         delete pipeStream;
00469         input = NULL;
00470         pclose(filePipe);
00471     } else {
00472         fileStream->close();
00473         delete fileStream;
00474         input = NULL;   
00475     }
00476 
00477     delete [] node;
00478 
00479     return true;
00480 }
00481  
00482 bool 
00483 RDFParser::parseConfig(char* pathFile)
00484 {
00485     bool parsed = true;
00486     
00487     string line;
00488     string property;
00489     string value;
00490     
00491     map<string,string>::iterator it;
00492     
00493     config.open(pathFile, ifstream::in);
00494     
00495     if (config.good())
00496     {       
00497         // Load a map with all pair property-value
00498         while (getline(config,line))
00499         {
00500             if (line.length() > 0)
00501             {
00502                 size_t pos=line.find("=");
00503                 
00504                 if (pos != string::npos)
00505                 {           
00506                     // Read property-value
00507                     property = line.substr(0,pos);
00508                     value = line.substr(pos+1);
00509                     
00510                     // Remove spaces
00511                     property.erase(remove_if(property.begin(), property.end(), isblank), property.end());
00512                     value.erase(remove_if(value.begin(), value.end(), isblank), value.end());
00513                     
00514                     it = properties.begin();
00515                     properties.insert(it, pair<string,string>(property,value));
00516                 }
00517             }
00518         }
00519         
00520         parsed = true;          
00521     }
00522     else
00523     {
00524         cout << "   <ERROR> Check the config file in " << pathFile << endl;
00525         parsed = false;
00526     }
00527 
00528     return parsed;
00529 }
00530 
00531 void 
00532 RDFParser::parseTripleN3(string t)
00533 {
00534     string value = t;
00535     int pos = 0;
00536     int firstIndex=0;
00537     int lastIndex=0;
00538     bool errorParsing=false;
00539     
00540     node[0]="";
00541     node[1]="";
00542     node[2]="";
00543 
00544     while (true)
00545     {
00546         value = value.substr(firstIndex);
00547                   
00548         if (value=="." || value=="\n" || value == "" || value.at(0)=='#')
00549             break;
00550                  
00551             //obvious space 
00552             if (value.at(0)==' ')
00553             {
00554                 //do nothing
00555                 lastIndex=0; 
00556             }
00557             //URI   
00558             else if (value.at(0)=='<')
00559             {
00560                 lastIndex = value.find(">");    
00561                 //check size of pos
00562                 if (pos>2)
00563                 {
00564                     errorParsing=true;  
00565                     break;      
00566                 }
00567                     node[pos] = value.substr(0,lastIndex+1);
00568                     pos++;
00569             }
00570             //Literal  
00571             else if (value.at(0)=='"')
00572             {
00573                 lastIndex = value.find('"',1);
00574                 //check if literal is escaped
00575                 while (true)
00576                 {
00577                     bool escaped = false;
00578                     int temp = lastIndex-1;
00579                     
00580                     while (temp>0 && value.at(temp)=='\\')
00581                     {
00582                         if (escaped) escaped=false;
00583                         else escaped = true;
00584                         temp--;
00585                     }
00586                     
00587                     if (!escaped) break;
00588                     lastIndex++;
00589                     if (lastIndex==value.length())
00590                         //Cannot find the (unescaped) end
00591                         errorParsing=true; 
00592                     lastIndex = value.find('"',lastIndex);
00593                     if (lastIndex==string::npos)
00594                         //Cannot find the (unescaped) end
00595                         errorParsing=true;        
00596                 } 
00597                 
00598                 // literal can extend to a bit more than just the ",
00599                 // also take into account lang and datatype strings
00600                 if (value.at(lastIndex+1) == '@') 
00601                 {
00602                     // find end of literal/lang tag
00603                     lastIndex = value.find(' ', lastIndex+1) - 1;
00604                 } 
00605                 else if (value.at(lastIndex+1) == '^') 
00606                 {
00607                     lastIndex = value.find('>', lastIndex+1);
00608                 }  
00609                 //check size of pos
00610                 if (pos>2)
00611                 {
00612                     errorParsing=true;  
00613                     break;      
00614                 } 
00615                 node[pos]= value.substr(0,lastIndex+1);
00616                 pos++;
00617             }
00618             //blank, a variable, a relative predicate
00619             else if (value.at(0)=='_' || (value.find(":")!=string::npos))
00620             {
00621                 lastIndex = value.find(" ");    
00622                 //check size of pos
00623                 if (pos>2)
00624                 {
00625                     errorParsing=true;  
00626                     break;      
00627                 }  
00628                 node[pos]= value.substr(0,lastIndex);
00629                 pos++;
00630             }
00631             //parameter or variable ---> obviate for Triples. In future, add to a Hash
00632             else if (value.at(0)=='@'|| value.at(0)=='?')
00633             {
00634                 break;
00635             }
00636             // test if number 
00637             else
00638             {
00639                 // else it is a parsing error
00640                 lastIndex = value.find(" ");
00641                 for (int j=0;j<lastIndex;j++)
00642                 {
00643                     if (!isdigit(value.at(j))&&value.at(j)!='.'&&value.at(j)!=','){
00644                     errorParsing=true;  
00645                 }
00646             }
00647             
00648             if (errorParsing==false)
00649             {
00650                 node[pos]= value.substr(0,lastIndex);
00651                 pos++;
00652             }
00653                      
00654             break;   
00655         }
00656                  
00657         firstIndex = lastIndex+1;
00658     }
00659            
00660     if (errorParsing==true)
00661     {
00662         char* except = (char*)" :*********** FORMAT ERROR (NOT N3?) ***********"; 
00663         throw except;    
00664     }
00665     else if (pos!=0 && pos!=3)
00666     {
00667         char* except = (char*)" :*********** FORMAT ERROR (NOT N3?) ***********"; 
00668         throw except;
00669     }
00670 }
00671 
00672 
00673 RDFParser::~RDFParser()
00674 {
00675     delete header;
00676     delete dictionary;
00677     delete triples;
00678 }
